question.title: Open compose multiplatform dialog from java activity
question.body:
I'm working on an Android application that consists of several Java modules. I'm in the process of migrating these modules to Kotlin Multiplatform, starting from the lower-level modules and moving up to the app module while maintaining continuous integration for Android platform.

One challenge I'm facing is migrating views such as Activities, Fragments, and Dialogs to Compose Multiplatform, especially since these views are currently being used in Java modules.

For example, consider two Java modules: Module A and Module B, where Module B is a dependency of Module A. Module B contains a DialogFragment that is opened from an Activity in Module A. If I migrate Module B to Kotlin Multiplatform and convert the DialogFragment to a Compose Dialog, will it still be possible to open this Compose Dialog from the Java-based Module A?
